1 Installing Pyret

There are several options for installing Pyret.

1.1 Requirements

You need to have installed at least Racket 5.3.4 (the current version, 5.3.6, works great). You can get Racket at http://download.racket-lang.org/.

1.2 Via DrRacket Automatic Download

Open a new definition in DrRacket, and using File -> Install .plt File, select the URL tab. Copy and paste the URL below into the space, and click "Okay"

http://cs.brown.edu/~joe/public/pyret/pyret-current.plt

1.3 Via a .plt File

Download this .plt file:

http://cs.brown.edu/~joe/public/pyret/pyret-current.plt

Then, you can install by either (your choice, don’t do both):

  • Opening DrRacket, and using File -> Install .plt File..., then selecting the file you downloaded

  • Running raco setup -A pyret-current.plt from the command line

1.4 Via Github

Clone this repository: https://github.com/brownplt/pyret-lang. For example:

$ git clone https://github.com/brownplt/pyret-lang

Then build Pyret:

$ cd pyret-lang

$ make dep

$ make
